Inference: Quadruple-validation of thermally driven leak events
Description: Simultaneous leak detection, moisture rise, temperature deviation, and device activation confirm a true thermally influenced leak event with full sensor agreement.
short rationale: Fully detailed incident with timing, location, and activation; high reconstruction and profiling risk.

Inference: Identifying freeze–thaw induced leaks
Description: Sub-freezing temperatures followed by moisture increases, leak detection, and device activation signal freeze–thaw pipe failures.
short rationale: Freeze-driven failures with activation timing; event-specific but limited occupant inference.

Description: High temperatures with moisture spikes, leak detection, and device activation indicate leaks caused by thermal expansion or overheating damage.
short rationale: Overheat-related incidents tied to activation logs; strong incident specificity.

Inference: Differentiating condensation from pipe leakage

short rationale: Separates condensation vs. leaks; moderate context sensitivity with limited personal data.

short rationale: Operational timing gap during risky events; moderate privacy exposure via timestamps.

Inference: Identifying thermal masking of early moisture signals

short rationale: Shows incidents where signals lag due to cold; event-specific timing and location.

Inference: Thermal correction of leak severity estimation
Description: Combining temperature context with moisture rise and duration of leak detection helps refine severity estimation because liquids spread differently under varying temperatures.
short rationale: Per-incident severity adjusted by temperature; detailed reconstruction.

Inference: Locating thermally sensitive weak points in plumbing

short rationale: Maps thermal vulnerability by zone; location/history sensitivity.

Inference: Predicting leaks from temperature-driven precursor patterns

short rationale: Precursors with timelines per zone; supports forecasting.

Description: Leak detections at normal temperatures without moisture rise or device activation are highly likely to be false positives.
short rationale: Flags false detections lacking corroboration; low privacy impact.

Inference: Evaluating device mitigation effectiveness under temperature stress
Description: Moisture should decline and temperature should stabilize after device activation; persistent moisture or continued thermal drift indicates insufficient mitigation.
short rationale: Post-activation outcome per incident; moderate sensitivity.

Inference: Identifying leaks hidden behind insulation or walls

short rationale: Reveals hidden leak locations; event-specific location sensitivity.

Description: Moisture spikes at elevated temperatures with leak detection and device activation indicate structural hot-water leaks, while activation without moisture rise implies appliance discharge.
short rationale: Attributes events to appliances vs. structural leaks, exposing usage timing.

Inference: Detecting thermally driven intermittent leaks
Description: Leaks that appear only during specific temperature ranges and trigger activation inconsistently represent temperature-dependent intermittent leakage.
short rationale: Recurring temperature-bound incidents with activations; moderate-to-high incident specificity.

Inference: Inferring leak onset timing from temperature slope changes
Description: A temperature spike or drop immediately before leak detection and moisture rise helps pinpoint the moment thermal stress caused leak initiation.
short rationale: Sequence-based onset inference; moderate detail.

Inference: Thermal–moisture propagation rate analysis
Description: Higher temperatures accelerate moisture spread after leaks, while cold conditions slow spread, enabling dynamic propagation modeling.
short rationale: Modeling spread vs. temperature; low incident specificity.

Inference: Identifying residual dampness after thermal leak events
Description: If moisture remains elevated long after device activation and temperature normalization, post-leak drying processes are inadequate.
short rationale: Post-incident moisture persistence; moderate timeline exposure.

short rationale: Micro-leaks tied to temperature context; repeated subtle events with timing/location.

short rationale: Classifies cause with timing; detailed incident fingerprint.
